cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 125 miles SSE of Nassau and 325 miles SE of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northwest through the Bahamas, then turning north-northwest and paralleling the Florida east coast before approaching the Georgia–South Carolina coastline
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Close pass along the southeast Georgia coast near Brunswick rather than an inland landfall

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Fernandina Beach, FL to Edisto Beach, SC (includes entire Georgia coast)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Deerfield Beach, FL to Fernandina Beach, FL (no warnings yet along Georgia coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida east coast from Deerfield Beach northward through Georgia to the Savannah River and south-eastern South Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are likely (70% chance) with a 35% chance of 50-kt winds; hurricane-force gusts possible if the core tracks close to the coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 5–8 ft above ground possible along the Georgia coast, including Brunswick, if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–7 inches of rain possible with locally higher amounts; flash flooding risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and life-threatening rip currents; possible coastal erosion.
